column1: where $V$ denotes the volume of ${ R^2}$.
In NC gauge theory on fuzzy ${ R^2}$,
the cancellation of 2-loop effective action occurs in the planer and
non-planar sectors separately.  In NC gauge theory on fuzzy $S^2$, the
corresponding cancellation does not occur if
we consider planar or non-planar contributions separately.
In NC gauge theory on fuzzy $S^2$, the fermionic contribution gives
rise to extra terms represented by $F_3^p$ and $F_3^{np}$.
effective action even for $U(1)$ gauge theory.
The origin of this new term may be thought as
the spin connection of fermions in a curved space.
